column4: As I understand it, a 3s-bit OS can be run on a 64-bit processor of the same architecture (e.g. x86 and Xeon), and it will run faster than a 32 bit OS on a 32 bit processor of the same clock speed, but slower than a 64 bit OS on the same 64 bit processor; and you can run everything that works on the 32 bit processor.
somebody tell me if I'm wrong
or, "you can run everything that works on the 32 bit OS with the 32 bit processor"
excellent.  Any idea what the speed difference is like?
I read that 64 bit was kinda behind in the repositories.... so 32 is still the way to go.. even if it's not 30% faster
good question.. I find edgy cycled 50% between my Duo core2
could you expand on that explanation a bit?
well when I run the system monitor to see how much CPU my program is eating up... it's never using both processors at 100%.. and it gets me wondering if things are running slower than they could be
Okay, I get it now.  Thanks.
there's this dude I read about on hackaday... he joined together like 12 minimacs into one supercomputer.. beats a quadcore!
Well, I'm also looking at a supercomputer that you can order cases of 144 processors each
But the price is 'if you have to ask, you can't afford it'
I recall having the same confusion.. windows *seemed* easier cause it had c:/ drive and the disk was a:/
